content.question: Two solid conducting spheres, sphere <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and sphere <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, are made of the same material. Sphere <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is smaller than sphere <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and initially has a charge of <math alttext="q sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. Sphere <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is initially uncharged. The spheres are brought into contact and then separated and released from rest. When the spheres are released, sphere <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> has charge <math alttext="q sub A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and moves to the left with acceleration <math alttext="a sub A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, while sphere <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> has charge <math alttext="q sub B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and moves to the right with acceleration <math alttext="a sub B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following correctly compares <math alttext="q sub A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="q sub B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="a sub A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="a sub B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>? Assume gravitational effects are negligible.

choices.label: <math alttext="q sub A is less than q sub B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mrow><mi>q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math><math alttext="a sub A is greater than a sub B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="q sub A is less than q sub B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mrow><mi>q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math><math alttext="a sub A equals a sub B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="q sub A equals q sub B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math><math alttext="a sub A is greater than a sub B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="q sub A equals q sub B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math><math alttext="a sub A equals a sub B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="q sub A is less than q sub B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mrow><mi>q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math><math alttext="a sub A is greater than a sub B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
